snippet: Limited telephone and Internet infrastructure, and decreasing smartphone costs, mean most of Myanmar’s 60 million people will experience the Internet first through cellphones.
abstract: Myanmar's technology sector, long held back by limited telephone and Internet infrastructure, could experience surge amid rapidly developing cellphone network and decreasing smartphone costs; shift could mean that many of country's 60 million people will experience Internet for the first time through cellphones.
lead_paragraph: Limited telephone and Internet infrastructure, and decreasing smartphone costs, mean most of Myanmar’s 60 million people will experience the Internet first through cellphones.

headline.main: Tech Scene in Myanmar Hinges on Cellphone Grid
headline.print_headline: Tech Scene in Myanmar Hinges on Cellphone Grid
